page.description: Skip until a pattern is found, and scan over it . Return text that matches the pattern.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ScanSmatchI as C(pattern as c)

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: True indicates that the Find_Text exists in the buffer.

argument.name: pattern
argument.description: The text that you want to find in the buffer. You may use the "?" (single character) and "*" (any number of characters) expressions.

page.discussion: The <StringScanner>.ScanSmatchI() function indicates whether Find_Text (case insensitive) can be found between the offset and the end of the buffer. The offset is positioned immediately after Find_Text.
page.example: dim scanner as P dim txt as C txt = <<%text% This is wonderful text written by a great writer %text% scanner = stringscanner.create(txt) ? scanner.ScanSmatchI("der**l") = "derful" ? scanner.GetToOffset() = "This is wonderful" ? scanner.GetRemainder() =prose written by a technical writer of note.
